Using Requirements

The Requirement component allows users to create hierarchies of features to be added or enhancements to be made to your product. Using a requirements-driven development process, organizations can prevent consuming, costly misunderstandings and shorten time to market.

Using requirements enables your development team to:

  • Prioritize requirements by importance.

  • Identify the impact of changes to requirements.

  • Use requirements to estimate work.

  • Track the requirement lifecycle from submitted to completed or rejected.

  • Provide requirements with a context by linking them to files, change, requests, and topics.

The Requirement component can be used alone or in conjunction with CaliberRM. If desired, administrators and other authorized users can use the Requirement Import utility provided with the application server installation to import requirements from CaliberRM. Imported requirements are read-only in StarTeam. However, users with CaliberRM on their systems can double-click a requirement in StarTeam, automatically run CaliberRM, and use an alternate property editor (APE) to edit the requirement.

Note: Only organizations that have licensed the Enterprise Advantage version of this application have access to the Requirement component.
